## Simulation Framework
To capture the complexity of the urban terrain, I utilized:
* **Solver:** `simpleFoam` for steady-state incompressible flow.
* **Meshing:** `snappyHexMesh` refined around building edges.
* **Porosity:** Trees were modeled as porous zones with Darcy-Forchheimer coefficients.

# test



```{=html}
<div id="velocity-explorer" style="text-align: center; background: #f8f9fa; padding: 20px; border-radius: 12px;">
  <img id="heightSliderImage" src="images/slices/anim.0000.jpg" style="width:100%; max-width:900px; border-radius: 5px;">
  
  <div style="margin-top: 15px;">
    <p><strong>Height Level:</strong> <span id="heightValue" style="color: #007bff; font-weight: bold;">0</span></p>
    <input type="range" min="0" max="40" value="0" step="1" id="heightSlider" style="width:90%;">
  </div>

  <script>
    (function() {
      const slider = document.getElementById('heightSlider');
      const imgDisplay = document.getElementById('heightSliderImage');
      const valDisplay = document.getElementById('heightValue');

      if (!slider || !imgDisplay) return;

      const totalImages = 40; 
      const imageFolder = "./images/slices/"; 
      const images = [];

      for (let i = 0; i <= totalImages; i++) {
        const img = new Image();
        const frameName = i.toString().padStart(4, '0');
        img.src = `${imageFolder}anim.${frameName}.jpg`;
        images.push(img);
      }

      slider.oninput = function() {
        const idx = parseInt(this.value);
        if (images[idx]) {
          imgDisplay.src = images[idx].src;
          valDisplay.innerHTML = idx;
        }
      };
    })();
  </script>
</div>
```


## Discussion
The simulation suggests that a 15% increase in porous barriers leads to a 25% reduction in pedestrian-level wind speeds in the target zones.
